name: Carmel Valley Athletic Club
description: Carmel Valley Athletic Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Carmel Highlands, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. A membership is required to play. Players have access to restrooms, food, locker rooms, a pro shop or equipment store, water, and lights.

name: Carmel Valley Ranch Resort
description: Carmel Valley Ranch Resort is a place to play pickleball in Carmel Highlands, CA. There are 4 outdoor clay and hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The facility includes amenities like restrooms, water, and trainers or lessons. The courts can be reserved. A one-time fee is required to play.

name: Chamisal Tennis & Fitness Club
description: Come play pickleball at Chamisal Tennis & Fitness Club in Salinas, CA! There are 8 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. A membership is required to play. The courts can be reserved. Amenities include restrooms and water.

name: Claremont Manor Park
description: Claremont Manor Park is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Salinas, CA. There are 2 outdoor hard courts. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. The courts are free. Players have access to restrooms, water, and wheelchair accessibility. The courts cannot be reserved.

name: Kim Grant Pickleball Acadamey
description: Kim Grant Pickleball Acadamey is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Seaside, CA. There are 20 outdoor concrete courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. You can reserve the courts. The facility includes amenities like lights, a pro shop or equipment store, restrooms, trainers or lessons, and food. A membership is required to play.

name: Los Arboles Sports Complex
description: Los Arboles Sports Complex is a place to play pickleball in Marina, CA. There are 2 outdoor hard courts. The lines are overlaid on a tennis court, so the net is a little taller than a normal pickleball net. The courts are free.

name: Monterey Bay Racquet Club
description: Monterey Bay Racquet Club is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Monterey, CA. There are 10 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. A one-time fee is required to play. You can reserve the courts. The facility includes amenities like lights, restrooms, a pro shop or equipment store, water, trainers or lessons, and food.
fees: Fee required — Free for members / non-member fee is $20

name: Monterey Peninsula College
description: Monterey Peninsula College is a place to play pickleball in Monterey, CA. There are 8 outdoor acrylic courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. Players have access to wheelchair accessibility, restrooms, and water. The courts are free.

name: Monterey Sports Center
description: Come play pickleball at Monterey Sports Center in Monterey, CA! There are 3 indoor courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. A membership is required to play. Players have access to lights.

name: Monterey Tennis Center
description: Monterey Tennis Center is a place to play pickleball in Monterey, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts are free. The facility includes amenities like restrooms, a pro shop or equipment store, water, and lights.

name: Morris Dill Courts Pacific Grove
description: Come play pickleball at Morris Dill Courts Pacific Grove in Pacific Grove, CA! There are 4 outdoor acrylic courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. Reservations are not available. The courts are free. Players have access to restrooms, locker rooms, and wheelchair accessibility.

name: Quail Lodge
description: Come play pickleball at Quail Lodge in Carmel Highlands, CA! There are 2 outdoor hard courts. The lines are permanent, and portable nets are available. The courts can be reserved. A membership is required to play. Amenities include restrooms.

name: Spanish Bay Courts
description: Spanish Bay Courts is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Del Monte Forest, CA. There are 5 outdoor concrete courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are private. Players have access to restrooms, water, locker rooms, a pro shop or equipment store, and trainers or lessons. You can’t reserve the courts.

name: Via Paraiso Park
description:
The two dedicated pickleball courts are open 9 a.m to 5 p.m./dusk seven days a week.  There is a rack system for organizing open play.  
For more information about pickleball at Via Paraiso Park as well as on the entire Monterey Peninsula, please see "Where to play pickleball on the Monterey peninsula" at this URL: Montereypickleball.com

name: Wheeler Street Tennis Courts
description: Wheeler Street Tennis Courts is one of the most popular places to play pickleball in Seaside, CA. There are 4 outdoor hard courts. These are dedicated courts with permanent lines and nets. The courts are free.
